articleContent.title: Chord: 11th in E (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 11th in E

## Brief Presentation
The 11th chord in E is a rich and colorful chord that adds complexity and depth to a musical composition. It consists of the root note E, major 3rd (G#), perfect 5th (B), dominant 7th (D), and the 11th note (A). The 11th chord is an extension of the dominant 7th chord, giving it a jazzy and sophisticated sound.

## Notes and Intervals
- E (Root)
- G# (Major 3rd)
- B (Perfect 5th)
- D (Dominant 7th)
- A (11th)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The 11th chord in E has a lush and jazzy flavor, creating a sense of tension and resolution. It is often used in jazz, R&B, funk, and neo-soul music to add color and complexity to chord progressions. The chord offers a modern and sophisticated sound that can enhance the harmonic structure of a song.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the 11th chord in E:
1. "Cantaloupe Island" by Herbie Hancock
2. "Sir Duke" by Stevie Wonder
3. "Red Baron" by Billy Cobham

These songs showcase how the 11th chord in E is utilized in different genres and musical contexts to create interesting harmonies and textures.
